  14. I received the Insta Natural Vitamin C Serum for free for use and review. It came in a pretty blue glass bottle with an orange-reddish label. The liquid was a cloudy light orange color, thickish as opposed to watery. What was so tantalizing about it was the fragrant scent of oranges. I do not mean artificial candy orange, but pure orange like juice from a fresh squeezed orange. Tasting it was empting, nut obviously not an option! It was a pleasant surprise and made application more pleasing to the senses. The scent did not longer, so you did not smell like a vitamin C tablet all day. The liquid came out in a dropper format and it came out slowly enough so you could control the amount. It went on very smoothly and spread across the skin very nicely. It left a softness and did not have a sticky feeling. The nice part of this serum is that it is made of natural ingredients. including 20% Vitamin C which may account for the pleasant scent. Vitamin C is an antioxidant used to help repair the skin and to help avoid future damage. Other ingredients include: Hyaluronic Acid (moisturizes skin), Tea Tree Oil (a skin soother), and Retinol (a pore de-clogger). It does not matter what type of skin you have (dry, oily, or combo) as this products is &#34;one size fits all.&#34; There was a noticeable difference in the diminishing of fine lines especially around my mouth and eyes. I felt as if my skin was more youthful. Everything you would want in a skin serum can be found in one bottle. I would highly recommend this product.
  15. I've only used for 3 weeks. I have noticed a slight change, but nothing big. Let's see when I finish the bottle if the changes are noticeable.

I find if I use it daily it is too drying and my skin flakes too rapidly as I do want to use a foundation daily. I found that about twice a week for the Salicylic acid one is perfect and the off days I use their serum with Vitamin C & Hyalauronic Acid but no Salicylic Acid. It's, uh, resurfacing my skin? Haha. My husband chastises me for still using it. I may actually have to stop using it because it really hurts. I don't usually have sensitive skin. And my face is usually oily, so. Wow. This stuff. yeah, I'm probably being an idiot.

Also, once I realized that things were not getting better the option for return was no longer available. So, I am out $$ on a product that didn't work at all for me. I only use it at night because of this and I always follow up with the night cream. If you have sensitive skin like I do, I do not recommend using this serum more than once a day. I can say however, that there is a noticeable difference in my skins condition and appearance and I feel I look healthier than I ever have.<br /><br />I now can wear less makeup and even feel comfortable wearing my hair out of my face on a regular basis. The smell goes away once it soaks in, so you won't smell like an orange all day. There is a very slight burn on any existing blemishes, but goes away quickly. Normally the serum's consistency is milky and it soaks into my skin without feeling greasy. My skin experienced minor peeling the first time, and my skin looked bright the next morning. However keeping the 3rd one in the refrigerator was a BIG mistake. The consistency became transparent and the serum seemed to have lost it's potency. I no longer experienced peeling or my skin didn't feel fresh or rejuvenated as before. I would highly recommend this serum, but be aware of the temperature. A bit hot or cold might make it lose it's potency.

  520. I recently learned about the miraculous Vit C Serum, and read that L-Ascorbic Acid is the only efficacious form of Vit C and so decided to order this serum from InstaNatural. Needless to say, I was expecting the Vit C to be L-Ascorbic Acid. However, it was only when I received a follow-up Welcome email from InstaNatural that I learned that the Vit C is actually Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate, its more stable cousin. I would have liked to have known that up-front before I made my choices. When I contacted Customer Care at InstaNatural about this, their service was incredible as they patiently and quickly responded to my queries and concerns. End result was I decided to give it a go since I'd already got the product anyway. On first application, my skin got red and tingly but it settled down after 30 minutes. I've been using this product for 10 days now, and every once in a while, I still feel some mild stinging, which I'm hoping is a sign of it working! I have however, yet to notice any lightening of sun damage spots or reduction in pore size but it's early days yet and I'm hopeful and optimistic. Happy to say that though I've been using it for just 10 days, it's already cleared up my breakouts, which is an unexpected bonus! 11 Mar 15: Update after 5 weeks of usage in conjunction with Rose Water Toner, Hyaluronic Serum and Vit C Moisturiser: There is definitely an improvement in my skin - tauter and smoother, and some fine lines reduced However, no visible difference in reducing pore size. 8 Apr 15: Update after 10 weeks of usage conjunction with Rose Water Toner, Hyaluronic Serum and Vit C Moisturiser: My skin definitely looks more radiant and less tired, but the fine lines and pores are still my ever-faithful companions. That said, I AM 60, but nobody believes it:) The real test will be when my daughter returns after 10 weeks away - she'll be able to tell if there's been progress!

  568. I bought this wonderful serum less than a month ago based on a number of factors. For most of my adult life I bought over priced and over hyped skin care products from department store cosmetic brands. Some of them were effective at improving my skin, but a vast number were more effective at draining my checking account than keeping my wrinkles at bay. Finally I decided to use my science based education and start focusing on the ingredient lists of a specific product rather than the marketing. What a discovery! With some research, I started buying skin care products with the specific ingredients that were known to target my personal skin needs. I soon found great products at affordable prices that made visible improvements in my skin because the products had ingredients in high enough concentration to actually help my skin. This Age-Defying Skin Clearing Serum made by Insta Natural is a superb example of my ingredient-based research. I read the Ingredient List very carefully and realized this serum's ingredients matched my needs very well, was just what I was looking for and at a great price. The high concentration of Vitamin C plus the retinol and other skin loving ingredients sold me on this serum, as well as the affordable price.<br /><br />I ordered the serum and was pleased with the prompt delivery and damage proof packaging. I immediately started using it as directed and twice a day. The serum is not oily. It has a silky sort of feel to it and was quickly absorbed. The smell was very light and pleasant, to my nose anyway. I did not feel any stinging or irritation. There was only a nice firming feel to the serum. I found that patting the serum onto my skin and then pressing the serum into my skin with the palms of my hands worked better than &#34;rubbing&#34; it onto my skin. I used it on my face, neck, and chest before applying any creams. Because of the high concentration of Vitamin C, retinol and AHA, I avoided putting the serum in the corners of my mouth and near the entrance of my nostrils because these areas of my face are sensitive to these ingredients. After several days I noticed a definite improvement in the texture, tone, and areas of discoloration of my skin. For some reason, this really showed on my neck and chest, which was a very nice surprise! Being in my 60's, I notice any changes for the better in my skin. I also noted the lines in my forehead were smoothing out. Of course it is too soon to realistically judge how the serum will improve my skin over time, but I am optimistic. I will certainly keep using this serum on a twice a day basis. I really enjoy everything about this product and would recommend it to my friends (of all ages) as a very well formulated, pleasant to use and effective skin care product. ( FYI, I was not asked to review this product, nor did I receive free product for a review. ) As a side note, I would encourage everyone to learn how to read and understand any product's ingredient list and research those ingredients as to what they are known to do and in what concentration the ingredient is most effective. We ladies spend a lot of our money on skin care. It only makes sense to become knowledgable about what we are buying. Plus we want to use only what is known to scientifically work based on sound research. After all we want results! lol The internet and some time make that possible. So do your homework, save a lot of money and most important, have beautiful skin at any age! I hope this review was useful. I am very pleased with this serum and look forward to using it in the future!

So the first week or so my face felt a tad swollen, especially under my eyes and I thought the product may be a dud that also stung a little. However, at the three week mark I did notice that some acne scars around my chin and my uneven skin tone, lightened, redness completely (90%) reduced and complexion evened out, I wasn't using the product for this reason so what a bonus! I had micro abrasion for the scars in the past but they weren't that noticeable, until they were gone! My goal for using this products was for fine lines and under my eyes, lines and tightening. I would say my skin does look brighter, I haven't had a pimple or even close to one the whole time I've used the product, which is rare to go so long without one. So, brighter, clearer, even, erased coloration of light acne scars, and has no lasting stickiness, I love the way it applies and soaks in. Also combines with a moisturizer well and I've actually started wearing less makeup because I don't need it. I am not quite sure how the serum will affect the wrinkles but my skin looks radiant and people have commented on how great it looks, men and women. I'm 30 yrs old, very fit, exercise, eat healthy, take biotin plus other vitamins and drink plenty of water so this product seems like just what I needed for clearer, better skin. I will monitor closely until the end of the bottle, which is also lasting a long time. I would recommend this product!

  833. I am 21 years old, and have always suffered from oily, acne prone skin. My face had cleared up for the most part this spring, but all of a sudden in July I got the most terrible hormonal acne breakout of my life. I know it was hormonal because it was all on my jawline. It's very upsetting to be entering adulthood with what I would consider a pizza face, since I also had some red marks on my cheeks as well. This acne was different than any acne I had as a teen as no matter how often I used typically reliable face washes and such that had worked over the years, the bumps wouldn't budge. I ended up doing a lot of research and decided the less chemicals the better, but still needed that one great adult acne fighting ingredient. Long story short retinol is where it's at, not only for anti-aging but for adult acne as well. Retinol essentially removes thin layers of your skin (slowly and not too harshly) promoting all of those impurities to be raised to you skin's surface for treatment.<br />That being said all of the ingredients in this product, but I credit mainly the retinol, have led to about a 90% reduction in the severe summer breakout that was terrorizing me! The retinol encouraged me to exfoliate those layers of skin coming off, and the salicylic acid then treats the blemishes brought up to the surface. The vitamin c also has a pleasing smell, and I believe has helped improve the overall texture of my skin.

Murad, ProActive, Neutrogena, Dr. Brandt, a bunch more hoity toity brands, and all led to the same conclusion. So I turned to Amazon and found InstaNatural. Based on the good reviews I first ordered this: http://smile.amazon.com/InstaNatural-Anti-Aging-Facial-Moisturizer-Cream/dp/B00KCTER3U/ref=pd_sim_194_23?ie=UTF8&refRID=1T4ADEY4P26PBRX2VPAY. Nothing else (I usually do the serum and a lotion). In the morning I use the serum and Neutrogena Clear Face http://smile.amazon.com/Neutrogena-Clear-Sunblock-Lotion-Ounce/dp/B004D2C5FY/ref=sr_1_7?s=beauty&ie=UTF8&qid=1435723257&sr=1-7&keywords=neutrogena+sunscreen and that's it.<br /><br />After a week you'll see some peeling and maybe some random breakouts (maybe even a cyst or two, don't freak out) while this is working all the nasty out of your skin. A couple of weeks later you're looking at 75%. In less than a month, my face was healed! No acne! The little red bumps went away. The cysts went away. And my face although still oily, is LESS oily. And the plus? Well reduced fine lines (no not gone, reduced), some plumping AND tightening of my skin, and a really nice glow! I love love love this stuff.<br /><br />But BE WARNED. This stuff has retinol so your face will be a lot more sensitive to sun. The Neutrogena sunblock is great, but wear a hat if you're going to be hanging out in the sun for while. You can get burned REALLY easily. I learned my lesson. But hey, guess what? This stuff got those red marks out within a week. I've been using this for about 3 months and the changes have been pretty significant. My skin looks so much better! I have to buy this stuff in bulk it is amazing!

It is a powerful combination of Vitamin C, Retinol and Salicylic acid. These are the top 3 ingredients in the product and also my personal top 3 for: lightening (C), smoothing (retinol) and clearing up skin (Salicylic acid). Salicylic acid has always been my go-to for breakouts anyway, but it can be drying on its own. Retinol is UV-sensitive, so I only use this product at night. My skin feels smoother, more supple and tighter after application. I would not say this is a super hydrating serum but for me I have combination skin so it balances both the dry and the oily without overdoing either. Most anti-aging serums I use leave a lot of oil behind, but not this. If you have combination skin that is going through a phase between still breaking out and also beginning to wrinkle, I would highly recommend this product.

I didn't purchase the body wash because I was afraid my Insurance wouldn't cover it (and I didn't want to get stuck with a 250 bill!!). I found an acne body wash on the shelf instead.
